Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with zinc (Zn) ions.
The action of a molecule that contributes to the structural integrity of the ribosome.

BioProcess.Detail: The cellular metabolic process in which a protein is formed, using the sequence of a mature mRNA molecule to specify the sequence of amino acids in a polypeptide chain. Translation is mediated by the ribosome, and begins with the formation of a ternary complex between aminoacylated initiator methionine tRNA, GTP, and initiation factor 2, which subsequently associates with the small subunit of the ribosome and an mRNA. Translation ends with the release of a polypeptide chain from the ribosome.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal structure of the bacterial ribosome from Escherichia coli at 3.5 A resolution. This file contains the 30S subunit of the second 70S ribosome. The entire crystal structure contains two 70S ribosomes and is described in remark 400.

PDB.Author: Schuwirth, B.S., et al.
